title: Texas County Flagged Need for Flood Alarm Months Before Tragedy
summary: Kerr County repeatedly failed to secure a warning system, even as local officials remained aware of the risks and as billions of dollars were available for similar projects.

title: Why the Texas Flood Site Didn’t Have Warning Sirens
summary: Officials in Kerr County made several attempts over the past decade to get funds for a flood warning system, but those applications were rejected. Christopher Flavelle, a reporter for The New York Times, breaks down what went wrong.

title: Texas City Racked by Floods Becomes a Hub for Search and Recovery
summary: Most summers, Kerrville, Texas, draws crowds for its July 4 celebration. This year, the streets are filled with emergency responders.

title: The F.B.I. Is Using Polygraphs to Test Officials’ Loyalty
summary: Some senior officials who have taken the test have been asked whether they said anything negative about the F.B.I. director, Kash Patel.

title: Trump Administration Is Forcing Prosecutors to Ignore Law, Whistle-Blower Says
summary: In an interview with The New York Times, a former Justice Department lawyer, Erez Reuveni, said officials pressed subordinates to mislead judges, and dared the courts to stop it.

title: Trump Threatens 35 Percent Tariffs on Canada in the Middle of Trade Talks
summary: The president revived his discredited claims about fentanyl entering the U.S. from Canada to justify his latest proposed rate of 35 percent.

title: Rubio and Chinese Diplomat Vie for Influence in Asia Over Trump’s Tariffs
summary: Marco Rubio wants to bolster ties with Asia to counter China’s sway, but President Trump’s tariff threats have nations asking why they should align with Washington.

title: Targeting Brazil, Trump Tests Legal Limit of His Tariff Powers
summary: The president signaled he would seek to use the threat of steep levies to reorient trade and protect his political allies.

title: Trump’s Copper Tariff Threat Leaves Companies Scrambling
summary: President Trump wants America to produce more of the much-needed mineral, but a 50 percent tariff could undermine his aim of a manufacturing renaissance.

title: Justice Dept. Demands Private Patient Info From Trans Youth Medicine Providers
summary: Doctors and hospitals were subpoenaed for private information on gender-related care for minors, the latest move by the Trump administration to stop the treatments.

title: RFK Jr. Cancels Meeting of Key Preventive Health Panel
summary: The task force recommends which screenings and other preventive health measures must be covered by insurance.

title: F.D.A. Posts Collection of Letters Outlining Concerns About New Drugs
summary: The letters, many of which were already available online, detail why the regulators initially declined to approve some drugs. All eventually passed muster.

title: State Department to Soon Begin Mass Layoffs
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio’s plan to downsize a “bloated” department had been on hold after a court ruling.

title: Justice Dept. Promised to Prosecute Abrego Garcia. Now It’s Not So Clear.
summary: In the case of Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia, the administration appears primarily concerned with ensuring that a man it has described as a “dangerous illegal alien” never walks free on U.S. soil.

title: Secret Service Suspends Six Agents Over Trump Assassination Attempt
summary: The announcement comes near the anniversary of the shooting at Donald J. Trump’s campaign rally in Butler, Pa.

title: Justice Jackson Says ‘the State of Our Democracy’ Keeps Her Up at Night
summary: At a bar association event in Indiana, the justice told those gathered that she is focused on drawing attention to what is happening to the government.

title: Billionaire Bill Ackman Loses Pro Tennis Debut at Hall of Fame Open
summary: Bill Ackman, an outspoken 59-year-old financier, competed in a professional tournament.

title: Nvidia Becomes First Public Company Worth $4 Trillion
summary: The A.I. chip maker reached the landmark before Apple and Microsoft, as its value rose more than tenfold after ChatGPT’s release in late 2022.

title: Angela Paxton Files for Divorce From Ken Paxton, Texas’ Attorney General
summary: The announcement could have a significant impact on the race for U.S. Senate in Texas. Mr. Paxton is challenging Senator John Cornyn in the Republican primary.

title: In South Carolina, Newsom Tests the Presidential Waters (Without Saying So)
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom of California met with Democratic voters in an early primary state that has become pivotal in presidential races.

title: Missouri Governor Signs Bill Rolling Back Voter-Approved Minimum Wage and Sick Leave
summary: The reversal reflected a growing struggle over the use of ballot measures to answer policy questions in Republican-led states.

title: Some of Iran’s Enriched Uranium Survived Attacks, Israeli Official Says
summary: The assessment came as experts are trying to determine how long it would take Iran to rebuild its nuclear program in the aftermath of U.S. and Israeli strikes.

title: Dave ‘Baby’ Cortez, Hitmaker Who Seemed to Vanish, Is Dead at 83
summary: His “The Happy Organ” reached No. 1 in 1959, but his pop stardom was short-lived, and his death in 2022, with an anonymous burial, remains a source of mystery.

title: The Law Is Not Enough to Stop War Crimes
summary: Prosecutions for atrocities are not always enough to stop hatred. Societies must also acknowledge what happened.

title: The Dollar’s in Trouble, but Not for the Reason You Think
summary: New payment systems allow users and banks to bypass the U.S. currency and sanctions.

title: At Least 13 People Died by Suicide Amid U.K. Post Office Scandal, Report Says
summary: A public inquiry into the wrongful prosecutions of about 1,000 postal workers has uncovered more victims than previously known, according to a report.

title: Livvy Dunne Tried to Buy Babe Ruth’s Former Apartment. An N.Y.C. Co-op Board Said ‘No’.
summary: The influencer and former collegiate gymnast tried to buy the Manhattan two-bedroom, but instead joined the ranks of high-profile rejects like Madonna and Calvin Klein.

title: Coal, the Last Survivor of Canada’s Parliament Hill Cat Colony, Dies
summary: For decades, a semiofficial feline assembly outside Parliament was a major tourist attraction.

title: James Carter Cathcart, Voice Behind Memorable ‘Pokémon’ Characters, Dies at 71
summary: Mr. Cathcart was known for playing the characters Professor Oak and Meowth in the long-running franchise. He also made appearances in other popular animated series such as “Yu-Gi-Oh!” and “One Piece.”
